paint.shared.utils

Class SharedSquareUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • paint.shared.utils.SharedSquareUtils

  • public final class SharedSquareUtils
extends Object
    Utility class providing methods for filtering and evaluating square regions in PAINT recordings. Supports both spatial filtering of track coordinates and multi-criteria visibility selection of squares.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • filterTracksInSquare

        public static tech.tablesaw.api.Table filterTracksInSquare(tech.tablesaw.api.Table tracks,
                                                           Square square,
                                                           int lastRowCol)
        Filters track coordinates to include only those within the specified square.

        This method handles inclusive or exclusive boundaries depending on whether the square is in the last column or row. It operates on a Tablesaw table containing at least "Track X Location" and "Track Y Location" columns.

        Parameters:
        tracks - table of track data with X/Y coordinate columns
        square - the square region defining coordinate boundaries
        lastRowCol - index of the last row/column in the grid (for boundary handling)
        Returns:
        new Table containing only the tracks located within the specified square

      • applyVisibilityFilter

        public static void applyVisibilityFilter(List<Square> squares,
                                         double minDensityRatio,
                                         double maxVariability,
                                         double minRSquared,
                                         String neighbourMode)
        Applies a visibility filter to all squares in a recording based on numeric thresholds and optional neighbour-based retention logic.

        Pass 1: Marks each square selected if it meets:

        • Density ratio ≥ minDensityRatio
        • Variability ≤ maxVariability
        • R² ≥ minRSquared and not NaN
        Pass 2: If neighbourMode != "Free", keeps only squares having at least one selected neighbour:
        • “Relaxed” → corner or edge adjacency allowed (dr ≤ 1 & dc ≤ 1)
        • “Strict” → edge adjacency only (dr = 1 & dc = 0 or vice versa)
        Parameters:
        squares - the list of squares
        minDensityRatio - minimum density ratio for selection
        maxVariability - maximum allowed variability
        minRSquared - minimum R² value for selection
        neighbourMode - neighbour logic: "Free", "Relaxed", or "Strict"

      • getTracksFromSelectedSquares

        public static List<Track> getTracksFromSelectedSquares(List<Square> squares)
        Retrieves a list of tracks from all selected squares in the provided recording. If a square is selected and contains tracks, those tracks are added to the result.
        Parameters:
        squares - The squares to be checked.
        Returns:
        A list of tracks from all selected squares in the recording.

      • getNumberOfSelectedSquares

        public static int getNumberOfSelectedSquares(Recording recording)
        Counts the number of squares marked as selected in the provided recording.
        Parameters:
        recording - The recording object containing a collection of squares.
        Returns:
        The count of squares that are marked as selected.

      • calculateDensity

        public static double calculateDensity(int nrTracks,
                                      double area,
                                      double time,
                                      double concentration)
        Calculates the density of tracks in a specified area over time and considering a concentration factor. The density is computed as the number of tracks divided by the area, then divided by the time, and finally divided by the concentration. If any of the area, time, or concentration values are non-positive, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        nrTracks - The total number of tracks to calculate density for.
        area - The area over which the density is calculated. Must be positive.
        time - The time period over which the density is calculated. Must be positive.
        concentration - The concentration factor to apply to the density calculation. Must be positive.
        Returns:
        The calculated density as a double.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if area, time, or concentration is less than or equal to zero.
